data.meta_description: Discover life events, stories and photos about George Theodore Koch (1896â1964) of Macomb, McDonough, Illinois, United States.
data.text:
When George Theodore Koch was born on 17 December 1896, in Macomb, McDonough, Illinois, United States, his father, Sebastian Koch, was 32 and his mother, Margaret Burke, was 36. He married Dorothy Gibson on 6 November 1930, in St. Joseph, Indiana, United States. They were the parents of at least 2 sons and 1 daughter. He died on 11 May 1964, in South Bend, St. Joseph, Indiana, United States, at the age of 67, and was buried in Saint Joseph Valley Memorial Park, Mishawaka, Penn Township, St. Joseph, Indiana, United States.

1904

Find a Grave Memorials shows that the earliest burial in this cemetery was in 1904: Ruth Elliott - BIRTH 15 Oct 1899 - DEATH -19 Jun 1904 (aged 4) - MEMORIAL ID 91580241

1906 Â· Gary, Indiana, Is Founded

The town of Gary, Indiana, was founded by the United States Steel Corporation in 1906. The Gary Works steel mill was the largest integrated mill in North America. The city of Gary was named after Elbert Henry Gary who was the founding chairman of the United States Steel Corporation and American lawyer and county judge. Gary partnered with J.P. Morgan, Andrew Carnegie, and Charles M. Schwab to found the United States Steel Corporation.

1916 Â· The First woman elected into the US Congress

Jeannette Pickering Rankin became the first woman to hold a federal office position in the House of Representatives, and remains the only woman elected to Congress by Montana.
